title: Hint possible ambiguous derive macros for extern crate

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
#[macro_use]
extern crate num_enum; // adds derive macro for `Default`

#[derive(Default)]
pub struct Foo {
    bar: i32
}
```

The current output is:

```
error: Expected enum but found struct
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 | pub struct Foo {
  |     ^^^^^^
```

Ideally the output should look like:
Hint that derive macros from `std::prelude::*` are overridden by extern crate.
It already hints if glob import is used:

```
error: Expected enum but found struct
 --> src/main.rs:6:5
  |
6 | pub struct Foo {
  |     ^^^^^^

error[E0659]: `Default` is ambiguous (glob import vs any other name from outer scope during import/macro resolution)
   --> src/main.rs:5:10
    |
5   | #[derive(Default)]
    |          ^^^^^^^ ambiguous name
    |
note: `Default` could refer to the derive macro imported here
   --> src/main.rs:1:5
    |
1   | use num_enum::*;
    |     ^^^^^^^^^^^
    = help: consider adding an explicit import of `Default` to disambiguate
    = help: or use `crate::Default` to refer to this derive macro unambiguously
note: `Default` could also refer to the derive macro defined here
   --> /home/user/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/prelude/mod.rs:129:13
    |
129 |     pub use super::v1::*;
    |             ^^^^^^^^^^^^
```
